title.narrative: Occupational Skills Survey in South-West and South East Serbia

description.narrative: The European Partnership with Municipalities Programme – EU PROGRES is a joint action of the European Union, the Government of Switzerland and the Government of Serbia aimed at enhancing the stability and socio-economic development of South and South-West Serbia, two of the most underdeveloped areas of the country. The EU PROGRES revolves around four components and eight results that deploy an holistic approach to accelerate growth and improve living conditions by reducing poverty, decreasing unemployment, improving infrastructure, as well as strengthening social and education services Component 1: Good Governance Result 1: Participatory, accountable and transparent governance, respecting human rights Component 2: Municipal Management and Development Planning Result 2: Municipal organizational effectiveness and efficiency improved and capacities to deliver services to citizens and business increased Result 3: Capacities for planning municipal and regional sustainable development strengthened and relevant development documents created Component 3: Physical, Economic and Social infrastructure Result 4: Projects and project documentation prepared for key economic, environmental and social projects Result 5: Project financing facilitated through enabling contacts with ministries, donors and other projects Result 6: Selected projects financed and implemented through the EU PROGRES Component 4: Public Awareness and Branding of Areas Result 7: Awareness of the need for, the logic of, and the effects of changes communicated to a broad public Result 8: A plan to develop the areas’ images and self-images as unique areas of Europe are established and implementation begun.

transaction.ref: SRB/13/01/UNO-2013-SRB130 - The delivery on the objectives of the employment policy is improved at national and regional levels.-C
